thesis.description: The arbitration of Industrial Disputes is becoming an increasingly important factor for the settlement of the social ills resulting from unsettled labour conflicts. In order to understand the legal basis of industrial arbitration in Quebec, the existing laws and regulations Controlling the arbitration of private disputes must be analysed. Due to the increasing back-log of cases before the courts, it is feit that many of these differenees could be settled quickly, amiably, equitably and cheaply, if submitted to impartial arbitrators. The aim of this thesis is to give a general picture of the evolution and practica of civil and industrial arbitration, and to examine the similarities and differenees in both procedures. [...]
thesis.creator: Cawadias, Constantine A.
thesis.subject: Comparative Law.
thesis.title: The arbitration of civil and industrial disputes in Quebec laws.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: An analysis of Québec crop production reveals an inadequate volume of crops yielding vegetable protein byproducts of suitable biological quality for poultry feeding, Climatic adaptability is a foremost prerequisite in any crop whose production could be encouraged to meet this deficiency. The horsebean (Vicia Faba L.) has already been grown to a limited extent in Québec and the Maritime Provinces, and would appear to offer some promise in this development. It is a leguminous plant which is well adapted to a cool humid climate, the seed possesses fairly high protein content (25 - 27 per cent), and it gives a good yield on any reasonably fertile soil.
thesis.creator: Brisson, Germain J.
thesis.subject: Fava bean as feed.
thesis.title: Feeding value of horsebean (Vicia faba L.) for chicks.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A study of the beta-decay of 46 day Hf181 has been made using a thin magnetic lens spectrometer. The beta-spectrum has an apparent end-point of 0.419 ± 0.024 Mev but because of the presence of conversion lines could not be analyzed for complexity. Conversion lines at 64 ± 0.6, 118 ± 1, 269 ± 3, 404 ± 4 and 457 ± 5 Ker are attributed to the internal conversion of gamma-rays of energies 131 ± 1.3, 185 ± 2, 336 ± 4 and 4711 5 Kev. Evidence exists for gamma-rays of energies 231 ± 5 and 248 ± 4 Kev but the conversion lines were not resolved. Absorption experiments indicate an additional gamma-ray of energy 630 ± 40 Kev. Gamma-gamma coincidences were obtained indicating gamma-rays in cascade. Beta-gamma coincidences on the spectrometer also indicated gamma-rays in cascade.
thesis.creator: Brannen, Eric.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: The disintegration of hafnium of mass 181.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Dans cette etude nous nous proposons dfexaminer les traits divers de l'enfant comme Victor Hugo le peint. De temps en temps il est necessaire de faire des digressions pour expliquer brievement certains aspects de la philosophie du maltre ou pour accentuer ses themes humanitaires. S'il y a des digressions apparentes, nous les faisons expres afin de donner de notre sujet 1'expression la plus nette et la plus entiere. Si nous allons etudier un aspect particulier d'une grande oeuvre litteraire, il faut mettre autour de notre sujet un cadre plus ou moins bien determine; la philosophie et la pensee generale de l'auteur representent le decor qui donne de la signification au personnage principal. [...]
thesis.creator: Bowes, Walter Gordon.
thesis.subject: Hugo, Victor, 1802-1885 -- Criticism and interpretation.
thesis.title: L’enfant dans l’oeuvre de Victor Hugo.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A method of introducing harmonie distortion into an audio amplifier, by means of a non-linear device, of such nature as to compensate for the harmonie distortion, intrinsic to certain types of power output tubes, is described. Details of the design of a model, which was constructed to enable experimental testing of the theory and the results of this testing are also given.
thesis.creator: Bourne, James Douglas.
thesis.subject: Electrical Engineering.
thesis.title: A method of reducing the harmonic distortion in audio amplifiers.

thesis.description: Lysine was first isolated in 1889 from casein hydrolysate (21). It was precipitated with phosphotungstic acid and then crystallized as the hydrochloride after removal of the acid with barium hydroxide. The following technique was the basis for the first method of determining lysine in protein hydrolysates: histidine was precipitated from the alkaline hydrolysate with mercuric chloride, arginine was removed as the silver sait from the remaining solution after saturation with barium hydroxide and finally lysine was separated from the remaining amino acids by précipitation with phosphotungstic acid and crystallizati on as the picrate sait after decomposing the phosphotungstate with barium hydroxide (35). This procedure has been modified slightly (36, 58, 61) but the principal steps in the method have remained the same. Micromodifications have been developed which can be used on small amounts of proteins (11, 9, 39, 54). [...]
thesis.creator: Boulet, Marcel A.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Chemistry.
thesis.title: A modified method for the determination of lysine and its application to reactions between reducing sugars and amino acids.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The initial objeot of the research was to convert cellulose, a linear polymer, into branched-chain polymere of known constitution by condensing some of its free hydroxyl groups with acetobromoglucose, acetobromocellobiose, or acetobromocellodextrins. A comparison of the linear starting material and the branched products would then reveal the effect of known amounts of branchlng on solubility, fiber formation, vlscosity and other physical properties. Such information would be of great value in developlng an accurate knowledge of amylopectin, the branched-chain component of starches.[...]
thesis.creator: Booth, Kenneth Gordon.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Attempted synthesis of a branch-chain cellulose and the unreliability of the periodic method of estimating branching.

thesis.description: This report deals with an attempt to identify and measure individual differences in certain areas of ability dependent upon tactual sensitivity. After extensive preliminary work three areas of ability were defined and seven experimental tests developed. These tests were administered to small groups of subjects and three of the tests were selected for further investigation. A comprehensive analysis was made of the results obtained when the three tests were administered to a sample of fifty military tradesmen. This analysis indicates that a Tactual Test of Spatial Relations developed in the study is capable of reliable measurement* Two tests of tactual acuity are considered to be of limited value as measures of tactual sensitivity.
thesis.creator: Sloan, E.P.
thesis.subject: Psychophysiology.
Touch.
PSYCHOLOGY, APPLIED.
thesis.title: An experimental investigation of individual differences in tactual perception.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Studies on the Interaction of calcareous liming and phosphate uptake were begun using neutron-bombarded monocalcium phosphate and neutron-bombarded superphosphate. Greensboro loam, a soil type previously studied on the Macdonald College Sawyerville plots (32), was used. The experiment was set up in the greenhouse as a split-plot design with six replicates of prelimed and unlimed Greensboro loam fertilized with the monocalcium phosphate and a similar supplementary trial with the superphosphate. Banner oats were used to measure the uptake of the soil phosphorus and fertilizer phosphorus.[...]
thesis.creator: Fiskell, John Garth Austin.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Chemistry.
thesis.title: The use of radioactive phosphorus in the investigation of fixation and release phenomena in soils.

thesis.description: The methods of overcoming the problem of high diagonal tension stresses in flat plate construction are: (1) to change the building dimensions or the concrete strength or both, (2) to use grillages, (3) to use a reinforcement system made from ordinary reinforcing bars. An increase in the concrete strength is the most economical method but does not permit the diagonal tension stress to be increased by more than 33 percent. The second method is about eight times as costly as the increase in concrete strength and about four times as costly as the third method. The second method has been certified by building codes. The third method is the subject of this thesis.[...]
thesis.creator: Ellis, John Stewart.
thesis.subject: Civil Engineering.
Applied Mechanics.
thesis.title: Diagonal tension reinforcement for 6" sections for flat plate construction.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: [...] The small decrease of the rate of disappearance of potassium persulfate, k1, at high mercaptan concentrations is not explained by this mechanism. If the effect is real, as itappears to be, since the magnitude of the decrease in the rate is approximately twice that considered to be significant, the some other factor must be complicating the reaction at thesehigh mercaptan concentrations. There is the possibility that the presence of large quantities of mercaptan affect the analysis for potassium persulfate. If a constant, absolute amountof potassium persulfate were not found in each analysis, i.e., a larger amount of eerie sulfate solution was required in each back titration, the result would be a smaller apparent value of k1. There is, however, no reason to believe that this occurred.
thesis.creator: Eager, Richard Livingston.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The oxidation of mercaptans by potassium persulfate in homogeneous solution.

thesis.description: The beta and gamma spectra of 6.9 day lutecium have been measured using a thin lens spectrometer. Gamma rays of average energies 112.2 ± 0.6 kev., 206.3 ±1.0 kev., and 317-3 ± 1.5 kev., have been found, the former two of comparable intensity and the latter much weaker. Characteristic X-radiation from Hf has also been observed. These energies are computed from four conversion lines on the beta spectrum at 46.9± 0.5 kev., 101.8±0.6 kev., 109.9 ±0.6 kev., and 141.4 ±0.8 kev., as well as from photoelectron lines using lead, gold, and tin radiators. Beta end points based on a Kurie plot occur at l69±10 kev., 366 ± 25 kev., and 495± 5 kev. A decay scheme is proposed consistent with these results. The great importance of avoiding source charging has been demonstrated by shifts of the conversion lines up to 20 kev. when a source mounting of thin nylon was used. Decay has been followed for 400 hours and the half period found to be 6.98 ± 0.10 days.
thesis.creator: Douglas, Donald George.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: The disintegration of lutecium of mass 177.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: It is shown how to space series and shunt slots on a wave guide in order to obtain a beam emerging at angles 10° - 30° to the normal. Using matrix methods, the V.S.W.R. is shown to be less than 1.3. Formulae are developed for the calculation of the magnitude of the series and shunt elements, given the gabling on a power basis. Account is talc en of attenuation . An 80 inch, K-band, linear array of 250 slots, was designed and constructed. Tests showed the squint to be 20° as predicted. The beam width was 0.47° to half power, while the lobes were less than 11% on amplitude. The V.S.W.R. was less than 1.3 over a bandwidth of 7%. [...]
thesis.creator: Dodds, J.W.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Design and construction of a travelling wave, K-bank, linear array, with a 20 degree squint.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Guinea pigs and rats digested the shredded wheat and ground wheat diets very well. Expressed in terms of dry matter, the digestibility coefficients ranged from 85-90%. The nutritive value of the two diets based on digestible energy varied from 83 to 89%. The guinea pigs digested the energy of the shredded wheat more efficiently than that of the ground wheat diet. The rats utilized the energy of the two diets almost equally. The value of total digestible nutrients was higher in shredded wheat than in ground wheat for the guinea pigs; the difference was less for the rats. The ranges of the digestion coefficients of the different fractions of the two diets were small except for the crude fibre (10-51%) and the ether extract (34-80%). The guinea pigs digested the crude fibre more completely than did the rats: the rats utilized the ether extract more thoroughly than the guinea pigs did.
thesis.creator: Dju, M.Y.
thesis.subject: Nutrition.
thesis.title: The relative nutrition of shredded wheat versus baked ground wheat as measured by digestibility trials by guinea pigs and rats.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: [...] However, two hospitals, the Illinois Neuropsychiatric Institute in Chicago and the Allan Memorial Institute of Psychiatry in Montreal, were interested in the writer's proposed consideration of placements and after-care where protective environments are used. These two institutions gave the writer access to the cases used in this study. The cases have been studied from the viewpoint of the psychiatric social worker in the hospital from which the patient was discharged. We consider the ways these patients make or fail to make the necessary adjustments, showing always the role the psychiatric social worker has taken, or might possibly have taken, In her help with these adjustments. The problem has been approached by considering the salient aspects of placement in as far as possible in the same order that a worker might approach one case referred for placement.
thesis.creator: Dean, Rena.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: The use of protective environemtns for girls and women discharged from Mental Hospitals.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: It is general nowadays for Master's theses to be 'original' or 'creative'. This thesis lays no such claim. In effect it is a re-test of an experiment on visual perception conducted recently at Harvard University by J. Bruner and C. Goodman. Our justification for this deviation from tradition rests in our agreement with our Research Director that an experiment which formulates tests, and validates hypotheses which are of importance to a science is certainly worth repeating. [...]

thesis.subject: PERCEPTION.
WORTH.
PSYCHOLOGY, EXPERIMENTAL.
Psychology.
thesis.title: Value as a perceptual determinant.

thesis.description: [...] Although much has been written and a great deal of elegent theory developed for numbers of the form x + iy, where i2 = -1 and x and y are real numbers, viz, the ordinary complex numbers; very little has been said concerning an analogous system of numbers of the form x + jy where j2 = 1. This system we shall term the "Hyperbolic Complex Numbers", due to their connection with the hyperbola and the hyperbolic functions. The purpose of this paper will be to develop the number theory properties of this system. [...]

thesis.subject: NUMBERS, THEORY OF.

thesis.title: The number theory of a system of hyperbolic complex numbers.

thesis.description: [...] Cette these a pour but de traiter comment Colette a vu et peint la nature en gdn^ral. Nous avons essays d'analyser son attitude en face du monde, c'est-a-dire, savision du monde aussi bien que la traduction de ce monde qu'elle nous a livre. Et nous avons voulu isoler ce que vision et traduction comportaient d'elements objectifs, ou sentimentaux, ou esthetiques, ou philosophiques. II existe deja a l'University McGill une these de maitrise intitulee Les Animaux dans Colette, qui est surtout une etude psychologique de certains animaux prefers. Nous nous proposons ici, en etudiant la nature, de considerer le sujet sous un aspect plus large, et c'est deliberement que nous negligerons la peinture de Toby Chien ou de Kiki-la-Doucette. [...]

thesis.description: [...] Now the intellectual, political and economic aspects of this period of English history are inextricably interwoven, for Deism produced ideas of the equality of men, and Democracy developed out of the new industrial organization. The author's concern, however, has been with the economic advances per se and the consequent social disorganization, and, most important of all, with the impact of the Evangelical Revival, an Independent movement which was associated with the other developments only in that it owed its origin perhaps to the reaction against existing conditions, upon the social upheaval. [...]
